content: block stitch button cowl - pattern - us crochet terms dreammakesbyjd block stitch button cowl this beginner friendly crochet cowl is a rectangle design using an aran weight variegated or colour transition yarn which can be styled with buttons and/or a fringe the finished cowl is approximately 86cm x 25cm 34 x 9 adult size but can be easily adjusted to suit by varying the starting chain length and number of row starting chain 5 5mm hook 1 chain 136 this gives a finished cowl of 44 blocks with one extra stitch at each end 2 add a stitch marker to the chain loop on the hook this will be the top of the turning chain note pattern repeat is 3 stitches plus 1 for a larger cowl add chains in groups of 3** row 1 change to 5mm hook 1 double_crochet into the 4th chain from hook do not count the chain on the hook this turning chain counts as 1 double_crochet stitch 2 double_crochet into each chain stitch until end hint crochet into the back bump of the chain to give a neat edge 3 check stitch count include turning chain is 134 - or - **your starting chain minus 2 page 1 block stitch button cowl - pattern - us crochet terms dreammakesbyjd row 2 first stitch 1 chain 1 & turn work does not count as a stitch 2 single_crochet in the first stitch top of the last double_crochet from previous row 3 single_crochet in the gap between the 2 double_crochet stitches 4 repeat *chain 2 skip 3 stitches single crochet in the gap between the 2 double crochet stitches* until end 5 single_crochet in the last stitch top of the gap between double_crochet turning chain row 3 chain 2 1 chain 3 counts as one double_crochet turn work space 2 repeat *3 double_crochet into the chain 2 space from the previous row* until end 3 double_crochet in the last stitch rest of cowl 1 repeat row 2 and row 3 until you reach the required width 25 row or 23cm/9 finishing on row 3 2 fasten_off last row and weave in all ends 3 block into size if required buttons button finish add 3 or 4 buttons to the long side spaced out evenly for the width of the cowl the chain 2 gaps on the other side are used to close the buttons fringe width of cowl fringe finish the fringe is added to two sections on the long side so it falls on the front of the cowl loop 1 use two yarn strands 25cm /10 cm long folded in half 2 use hook to loop the middle of folded yarn into the corner pull 3 pull loose ends through the loop ensuring ends 3rd double_crochet even lengths through 4 repeat between every 3rd double_crochet stitch to width of the cowl for both sections page 2 5 trim fringe ends as required block stitch button cowl -
